intro: Conicosia affinis, commonly known as the narrowleaf conicosia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal areas. Conicosia affinis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
